page.title: 01North Marston Village & Farm
page.content: The village of North Marston dominates the area. It is perched on a knoll some 400ft above sea level overlooking the surrounding lowlying and poorly drained grazing land. As its name indicates the area would have been marshland origionally and even today is liable to extensive flooding. Farming is this confined largely to the grazing of old permanent pastures. Population is about 700 persons and increasing steadily as new housing development takes place. Several farms are situated in the village in the old English style. Once a completely agrarian ecconomy the majority of the inhabitants now commute to the local towns for work and recreation. The village first (primary) school caters for several surrounding villages after which children move to Whitchurch & Winslow
